message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and triggers suggest lactose intolerance. The first-line therapy is diet modification, specifically avoiding lactose-containing foods. Omeprazole is used to treat gastroesophageal reflux disease, pancreatic lipase supplement is used to treat pancreatic insufficiency, and cholestyramine is used to treat bile acid malabsorption.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms along with the intolerance to dairy products suggest lactose intolerance, which is a biochemical disorder. The first-line therapy for lactose intolerance is diet modification, which involves avoiding or minimizing lactose-containing products. Other options are not appropriate for lactose intolerance. Omeprazole is a proton pump inhibitor used for GERD, pancreatic lipase supplement is used for pancreatic insufficiency, and cholestyramine is used for bile acid malabsorption.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and the fact that symptoms worsen after consuming dairy products suggest lactose intolerance, a common biochemical disorder. Diet modification, particularly reducing or eliminating lactose-containing foods, is the first-line therapy for lactose intolerance. Omeprazole is used to suppress stomach acid production, pancreatic lipase supplement is used to help digest fats when the pancreas can't produce enough of it, and cholestyramine is used to lower cholesterol levels. None of these options are appropriate for lactose intolerance.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest lactose intolerance, and diet modification is the first-line therapy, such as reducing or eliminating dairy products from the diet. Omeprazole is used to treat gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), pancreatic lipase supplement is used to treat exocrine pancreatic insufficiency, and cholestyramine is used to treat hyperlipidemia.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest lactose intolerance, which can be managed by diet modification, specifically avoiding or limiting lactose-containing foods. Omeprazole is used for acid reflux, pancreatic lipase supplement is used for pancreatic insufficiency, and cholestyramine is used for high cholesterol.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, specifically the worsened symptoms after consuming dairy products, suggest lactose intolerance. The first-line therapy for lactose intolerance is diet modification, specifically avoiding dairy products or using lactase supplements. Omeprazole is used for acid reflux, pancreatic lipase supplement is used for pancreatic insufficiency, and cholestyramine is used for high cholesterol levels.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The child’s symptoms after consuming dairy products suggest lactose intolerance, which is a common condition caused by the lack of lactase enzyme in the intestine. The first-line therapy for lactose intolerance is diet modification, specifically avoiding dairy products or using lactase supplements with dairy products. Omeprazole is used to treat acid reflux, pancreatic lipase supplement is used to treat pancreatic insufficiency, and cholestyramine is used to treat bile acid malabsorption, none of which are related to lactose intolerance.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest lactose intolerance, which is a common condition in which the body is unable to fully digest lactose, a type of sugar found in milk and dairy products. The first-line therapy for lactose intolerance is diet modification, such as avoiding dairy products or taking lactase supplements before eating dairy products. Omeprazole, pancreatic lipase supplements, and cholestyramine are not indicated for lactose intolerance.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms and the intolerance to dairy products suggest lactose intolerance. The first-line therapy for lactose intolerance is diet modification, avoiding foods that contain lactose. Omeprazole is used to treat gastroesophageal reflux disease, pancreatic lipase supplements are used to treat pancreatic insufficiency, and Cholestyramine is used to lower cholesterol levels.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms after consuming dairy products and ice cream suggest lactose intolerance. The first-line therapy for this condition is diet modification, specifically a lactose-free diet. Omeprazole is used to treat acid reflux, pancreatic lipase supplement is used for pancreatic insufficiency, and cholestyramine is used for bile acid malabsorption. None of these medications are appropriate for lactose intolerance.
